ca.mcgill.ecse211.mountev3rest.navigation

Class Navigation

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.mountev3rest.navigation.Navigation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class Navigation
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Provides an interface to move the robot to an arbitrary point on the grid. The Navigation enables the robot to go to arbitrary locations on the grid by computing the required distance and angle to reach it from the odometer's readings. Additionally, the class runs on its own thread to enable the caller to change direction at any point if an event occurs.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Navigation

        public Navigation(EV3LargeRegulatedMotor leftMotor,
                  EV3LargeRegulatedMotor rightMotor,
                  double wheelRadius,
                  double track)
           throws OdometerException
        Creates a navigator that will operate using the specified track and wheel radius values.
        Parameters:
        leftMotor - Left motor of the robot.
        rightMotor - Right motor of the robot.
        wheelRadius - Wheel radius of the robot't wheels measured in centimeters.
        track - Measurement of the robot's track in centimeter.
        Throws:
        OdometerException - If the singleton Odometer class has not been instantiated.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Runs the state machine main logic. This involves setting the direction of the robot to a new target if required.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • travelTo

        public void travelTo(int x,
                     int y)
        Sets current target and indicates the state machine to retrace the trajectory.
        Parameters:
        x - New target X position.
        y - New target Y position.

      • turnTo

        public void turnTo(double theta)
        Turns to an absolute angle with respect to the grid ensuring minimal rotation. Positive angles are defined as counter-clockwise rotation and vice-versa.
        Parameters:
        theta - Desired angle of rotation.

      • turnToRelative

        public void turnToRelative(double theta)
        Turns to an relative angle with respect to the current position ensuring minimal rotation. Positive angles are defined as counter-clockwise rotation and vice-versa.
        Parameters:
        theta - Desired angle of rotation.

      • isNavigating

        public boolean isNavigating()
        Indicates whether the robot is still navigating.
        Returns:
        Boolean values indicating if the robot is moving.
